metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9911 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the ures_getByKeyWithFallback function in common/uresbund.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) before 54.1 for C/C++ allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted uloc_getDisplayName call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> this was fixed in 54.0.1. chromium-browser has 56 now chrisccoulson> firefox has 56 at least since Firefox 50, and Thunderbird has 56 since at least 45.3 oxide has had 56.1 since at least 1.17

criterions.comment: android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
firefox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
icu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.5').
mozjs24: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17.9-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
